channel.title: Headphones Bitches!
channel.description:
I'm looking at headphones. I have some Sony ear hook-buds, but I'm looking for something with a bit more punch.
What do you recommend for a good pair of headphones that will deliver good bass, durability, comfort, and a good overall mixture of sound. I will be mainly using this for heavy metal, so maybe that factors into it.
Not looking to spend more than $100, folks.

item.title: Headphones Bitches!
item.dc:creator: horizonbreakk
item.description:
Koss Portapro
/thread

Read full topic

item.title: Headphones Bitches!
item.dc:creator: Shinobi
item.description:
I use Turtle Beach AK-R8s with an external sound card. 5.1 surround sound. Only problem with them is that they will hurt your ears after an hour and a half of using them and I use a laptop so its a pain to carry them around, so I usually just go with Skull Candy earbuds. They AK-R8s are $99.

Read full topic

item.title: Headphones Bitches!
item.dc:creator: nowhere
item.description:
Sennheiser HD280’s are pretty good closed back phones available at places like Guitar Center for about $100 or so. Comfortable and fairly rugged too.

Read full topic

item.title: Headphones Bitches!
item.dc:creator: Zageron
item.description:
Depending on where you are. London Drugs lets you try Cans, and over ear. Buds are sealed.

Read full topic

item.title: Headphones Bitches!
item.dc:creator: OldDirtyBastard
item.description:
You all suck. I go only for Bose and Grado.

Read full topic

item.description:
Huh, I didn’t realize they let you test headphones at Guitar Center…I must verify this!

item.title: Headphones Bitches!
item.dc:creator: johnyo
item.description:
Winged One:

I wish they’d let you test-run headphones at the store.

From what I’ve heard, you can, actually. People refer to that magic place as guitar center or something.

Read full topic

item.title: Headphones Bitches!
item.dc:creator: Winged_One
item.description:
I wish they’d let you test-run headphones at the store.

Read full topic

item.title: Headphones Bitches!
item.dc:creator: johnyo
item.description:
Audio Technica ATH-M50 (more bass)
Shure SRH-440 (more neutral)
Denon D1001 aka Creative Aurvana Live! (wouldn’t know)
Sony MDR-V6 or 7506 (more highs)
Sony MDR-XB700 (super bassy)
there’re also some good ones from Sennheiser

[EDIT] these are all closed-back cans. If you don’t care about sound isolation there’re a bunch of good open-back phones too.

Read full topic

item.title: Headphones Bitches!
item.dc:creator: Winged_One
item.description:
I’m prob going for cans.

Also I’ll prob look into the ATH M50 mentioned.

Read full topic

item.title: Headphones Bitches!
item.dc:creator: johnyo
item.description:
Well, I, for example, can’t stand wearing IEMs for more than a couple of hours and I also like the sound of full size phones better. I only use IEMs when I can’t take my cans with me.
Of course, there could be people who prefer IEMs to cans for all I know.

Read full topic

item.title: Headphones Bitches!
item.dc:creator: Winged_One
item.description:
Well, how do IEMs and closed cans compare in the sound department?

Read full topic

item.title: Headphones Bitches!
item.dc:creator: johnyo
item.description:
You looking for IEMs or cans?

portable phone comparison on Head-Fi
IEM comparison on Head-Fi

If you’re looking for full size closed cans ATH M50 is the best there is under $100.

Read full topic

item.title: Headphones Bitches!
item.dc:creator: Insomniac
item.description:
Steelseries Siberia V2 is great for gaming, someone else will have to say if they’re good enough for heavy metal though.
